channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023100784
item.description:
Report E-2023100784

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LOO experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release from multiple boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to a load shift. Sodium bicarb and absorbents were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All damaged bottles of product were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
